settings.text_2: Compact and convenient for use in various locations.

settings.custom_liquid:
Includes exclusive packaging

Get your rapid test kit delivered FAST NOW!

settings.heading: Ferrtin Blood Test
settings.content:
Why It's Important?
Ferritin is a blood protein that contains iron.A ferritin test measures the amount of ferritin in
your blood. Ferritin level is lower than normal which your body iron stores are IOW
and you have iron deficiency.
AS a result, you could be anemic. Ferritin level is higher than normal which indicates that you
have a condition that causes your body to store too much iron. It could also point to liver
disease, rheumatoid arthritis, other inflammatory conditions, hyperthyroidism or some
types of cancer.

settings.heading: Test Procedure
settings.content_2:
For whole blood specimen:
I. Bring the pouch to room temperature before opening it. Remove the test cassette from the
sealed pouch and use it as soon as possible.
2. Place the cassette on a clean and level su rface.
For Venipuncture Whole Blood specimen:
• Hold the dropper vertically and transfer 2 drops ofwhole blood (approximately 50pl) to the
specimen well, then add 1 drop Of buffer (approximately 40pl)t and Start the timer. See
illustration below.
For Fingerstick Whole Blood specimen.
Hold the dropper vertically and take a sample from fingerstick and transfer 2 drops of whole
blood (approximately 501.11) to the specimen well (S) , then add 1 drop Of buffer
(approximately 40wl) , and start the timer. See illustration below.
• Wait for the colored line (S) to appear. Read result at 5 minutes. Do not interpret the result

settings.custom_richtext:
Why It's Important?
Ferritin is a blood protein that contains iron.A ferritin test measures the amount of ferritin in
your blood. Ferritin level is lower than normal which your body iron stores are IOW
and you have iron deficiency.
AS a result, you could be anemic. Ferritin level is higher than normal which indicates that you
have a condition that causes your body to store too much iron. It could also point to liver
disease, rheumatoid arthritis, other inflammatory conditions, hyperthyroidism or some
types of cancer.

1. Whole blood compatible
2. Room Temperature stable.
3. Long shelf life of 2 years.
4. Simple to use test, with just a small blood sample, easily collected by a finger-prick
5. Results in 5 minutes, with easy interpretation.
6. Available in device format, under 10 tests and 50 tests packing.

Allow the test, specimen, buffer and /or controls to reach room temperature (15-300C) prior
to testing.
For serum or plasma specimen:
1. Bring the pouch to room temperature (15-300C) before opening it. Remove the cassette
From the sealed pouch and use it within one hour.
2. Place the cassette on a Clean and level surface. Hold the dropper vertically and transfer 1
full drop of serum or plasma (approximately 25pI) to the specimen well of the cassette, then
add I drop of buffer (approximately 40 VI) and start the timer. Avoid trapping air bubbles in
the specimen well. See illustration below.
3. Wait for the colored line (S) to appear. Read the result at 5 minutes when testing a serum or
plasma specimen.
settings.description_1:
For whole blood specimen:
I. Bring the pouch to room temperature before opening it. Remove the test cassette from the
sealed pouch and use it as soon as possible.
2. Place the cassette on a clean and level su rface.
For Venipuncture Whole Blood specimen:
• Hold the dropper vertically and transfer 2 drops ofwhole blood (approximately 50pl) to the
specimen well, then add 1 drop Of buffer (approximately 40pl)t and Start the timer. See
illustration below.
For Fingerstick Whole Blood specimen.
Hold the dropper vertically and take a sample from fingerstick and transfer 2 drops of whole
blood (approximately 501.11) to the specimen well (S) , then add 1 drop Of buffer
(approximately 40wl) , and start the timer. See illustration below.
• Wait for the colored line (S) to appear. Read result at 5 minutes. Do not interpret the result

settings.custom_richtext:
Please refer to the il lustration
1. < 13ng/ml: Two lines appear. No line appears in the test line region (T) . There may be a risk
of anemia forfemales and males.
2. >30ng/ml: Three lines appear. The line in test line region (T) is darker than the reference
line (R ). It depicts no iron deficiency anemia. Unless Ferritin levels are raised due to some
other reasons.
3. > 13ng/ml < 30ng/ml: Three lines appear. But the line in the test line region (T) is the same asorl ighter than the reference line (R). There may be a risk of anemia for males.
4. INVALID: Control line fails to appear. Insufficient specimen volume or incorrect
procedural techniques are the most likely reasons for control line failure. Review the
procedure and repeat the test with a new test. If the problem persists, discontinue using the
test kit im mediately and contact your local distributor.

settings.text:
Let our expert medical team guide you through all your testing and health concerns!
With years of experience in diagnostics and healthcare, our dedicated team is here to offer Premium Members personalized consultations and support for all your rapid testing needs. Whether it’s choosing the right test or understanding your results, we provide expert advice every step of the way."
